website_summaries.verdict: A good general-purpose shiner that can work on a variety of rubber/vinyl surfaces including tires.
pros: The liquid shine makes it easy to apply directly to the tire surface or to rub in on with a sponge or cloth
The liquid helps to darken the tire in addition to provide a shine coat
cons: The length of the shine can vary depending on the tire and application method

customer_reviews.title: works great if it doesn't rain
customer_reviews.text: works great if it doesn't rain! Lasted 1 day then it rained and left white "scratch marks " all over my plastic. Called chemical guys and they had no idea what I was talking about nor had a solution.
customer_reviews.author: sonya holdcraft

customer_reviews.title: Interior use only!
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent product if you use it in on interior trim/plastic parts. However, be forewarned, do not use it on exterior trim... at all, unless you live in a desert. At the slightest rain or even heavy dew during an early morning drive, it will run off the treated trim onto any nearby surface leaving an oily, hazy residue. It's not permanent nor does it cause lasting damage but it looks awful and require a the vehicle completely again to remove... during which the remaining original aoplication of VRP is washed away as well. Point is, other products do not have this shortcoming, go with them. Strongly recommend against spending money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Burris Fluharty

customer_reviews.title: Worst of all Chemical Guys produtcs
customer_reviews.text: Worst of all Chemical Guys produtcs, every other produtct exceeded my expectations but this goes on like oily Armor All and wears off upon a rainy day only to make a mess on every car surface close to rubber/plastic, did not provide that rich moist look that they advertise back to well cared for car plastics. Would not recommend, don't think I'd use again and there is a lot left in that bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Perez Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced crap with great marketing
customer_reviews.text: Bought a slew of products from this company and i must say i am not a fan. Overpriced crap with great marketing. Pics are after a slight drizzle. And no i did not lay it on thick.
customer_reviews.author: Erika A. Kobayashi

customer_reviews.title: LOVEEEEEEEEEEE VRP WHEN USED CORRECTLY!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional detailer. This is my go to tire shine. Every one here with a bad experience has applied incorrectly or used for an unintended purpose. You people should try restoring your plastic instead of covering it up with a tire shine. And You might get better results. Its a water based product. Dont be mad when water washes it away. Be bad at your self for that one. Aside from that. Try cleaning the plastics an rubber. With degreaser/alcohol before applying. No product will last on a dirty surface. And thats one thing you DIYers dont understand. PROPER PREP WORK IS KEY!
customer_reviews.author: Bk

customer_reviews.title: Better than most. Worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: I was alittle skeptical at first. I live in Arizona. So tires take a beating from the sun. I have some 4 year old tires and have tried armor all and other products. But they have always left streaks or dry spots and never gave me an even finish. I washed my tires and allowed to dry. Then I applied this cream. And BAM! My tires were like new. Easily applied with a small sponge. Only take a little per tire. Not greasy at all. Dry to the touch. And a pleasant aroma. Easy washed off hands with hand soap and didn’t linger smell. I would definitely recommend. Check out the picture. Before and after.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl B.

customer_reviews.title: But as soon as the moisture set in at night every black part on my car looked like it melted and ran down the trim
customer_reviews.text: I used this on the exterior black trim of my car, I live in CA so it doesn't rain often. But as soon as the moisture set in at night every black part on my car looked like it melted and ran down the trim. I did not apply this on thick, in fact I used very little and buffed out any left over. it also leaves my finger prints all over on the door where I have the black trim. It does give it a refreshed look. But looks awful if any sort of moisture comes in contact with it.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff.  Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber seals on my 2007 Tacoma are pretty nasty. They are brown with spots, possibly rot. My only solution was replacement ($$$). So I thought I'd try VRP. The first coat went on easy and the rubber soaked it in but almost immediately I could see it darkening up. I put down three more coats and now my seals all look brand new. Seriously. I reapply every month or so (just one coat) and it looks amazing. I started using this on my mirror trim and now they look new. Then I used it on my dash and door trim. They look new. I can't give this product enough stars.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Chemical Guys VRP gel after seeing several positive reviews and wanted to try it for myself. I own a 2016 Nissan Murano that has the black plastic trim on the lower bumper. The plastic over the years has started to fade due to weathering. I took the vehicle to the car wash and applied some of the VRP all around the vehicle where bare plastic was fading. The gel did a fantastic job! We took the vehicle to the beach a few days later and there was some strong rain on the way back home - the gel held up and it still has a great shine. Edit: Photos added.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar A.

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my Black Plastic
customer_reviews.text: I am normally a proponent of all chemical guys products I’ve been using them for years from their car wash to interior fragrance But this product literally ruined my plastic mirrors that were actually in very good shape I was giving my 2008 Jeep a full detail and literally usee this product on all the plastic and the side mirrors after a light rain turned my black plastic white with aweful streaks. I’ve tried every other product to remove the damaged left behind frim this product I am extremely disappointed . Againnormally every single product the chemical guys puts out is great but this one absolutely garbage. No Good Avoid at all cost!!! I’ll be calling them Monday.
customer_reviews.author: F H. Grau

customer_reviews.title: Very slick shine
customer_reviews.text: really soaks into your tires if you let it set for for few minutes (about 30 max) before moving your vehicle. keeps the tires shiny for at least 3-4 days if you're not driving through puddles. Dirty roads don't immediately effect it unless they're constant. Do NOT get this on your gloss/body coat if your accenting black/accent pieces around your body. Leaves a greasy-ish stain on the coat. Interior (dash, doors, etc.) lasts WAY longer than the tiers/exterior since it doesn't have to deal with the elements. It also smells REALLY nice, so it's kind of a plus to use inside.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Best product for matte shine
customer_reviews.text: After years of going to car wash tunnels where they apply that ultra shiny clear slime on your tires, you know the stuff that flies all over your freshly washed car as soon as you pull out of their parking lot, the stuff that if not applied correctly makes your tires spin. Well this product is a million miles away from that cheap Auto Bell tire dressing, it's not as shiny, gives your tires a brand new look and will not fly off on your quarter panels.
customer_reviews.author: C. Albanese

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am a HUGE (really big) fan of Chemical guys products. I get all my auto and rv finishes from them. I had to find a replacement for back to black and thought I would try this. A big disappointment. Washed off in the first rain storm and streaked the sides of my truck. As you can see from the photo, this was just one area. Both sides of the bed had the same issues because I applied it to the bed rails. Don't waste your money especially if you are in a wet climate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BE AWARE, this will streak terribly if it gets wet. Looks worse than if weathered. Crap product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had no idea this would turn my plastic to a streaked mess!!! I should have read separate reviews prior to application, as both my trucks look terrible!! Except tires are OK. This is not a good product if near a wet climate I guess. Should say in description, as now my Black Edition Ridgeline should be a black and grey streaked edition. Terrible mistake trying to be a good owner :( and my old GMC has same crappy results....BE AWARE
customer_reviews.author: L. T.

customer_reviews.title: From all the great reviews on this item I thought I'd give it ...
customer_reviews.text: From all the great reviews on this item I thought I'd give it a try. When you first apply it looks great. It's easy to apply and goes on evenly, no sling and dries to the touch. Bad news is that it does not last long, not even a week, it starts to get splotchy as it wears off. After a single rain its almost completely gone. I also notice that I have to use a lot more product then what I typically use. I Don't think I'll be repurchasing this again unless it is onsale for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: daisy lani

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Guys best product to date
customer_reviews.text: V.R.P. is the best dressings you can buy for your vehicle. It's great not only for the tires but anything plastic or rubber around the vehicle. I've used it in the dashboard and it's still shiny after a month from applying it. I use this stuff for everything now that I think about it. Tires, dashboard, lotion, cooking oil, salad dressing, lubricant, this dressing is the whole 9 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J.

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: DO NOT USE WHERE IT CAN GET WET...
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my tires after I just detailed the car and the wheels were pristine. It rained lightly and next things I know my wheels are all splattered as well as all over the lower part of my car. HUGE MESS. What a disappointment. It was easy to apply and smells pleasant. Even gave a nice shine, but I would never use it on anything but your interior. Quite frankly, Chemical Guys need to pull this product or not advertise for exterior use. I can't believe it's still being sold. Shameful.
customer_reviews.author: ibTom

customer_reviews.title: LONG lasting
customer_reviews.text: This is the best I've found so far. I used a cheap stubby paint brush to apply, which worked well - an idea I stole from some other review. I've spent way too much money over the years on tire shine products, and I think this will be my go-to product for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: Super easy..
customer_reviews.text: Chemical Guys bottled liquid paste is awesome. I used a basic kitchen sponge with the green scrubber. I wet down the sponge slightly. I first wiped down the rubber trim to my car, inside and out. I then placed a good amount of liquid on the sponge and wiped it on the surface. What a difference the rubber trim looks like now. all the surfaces look brand new. I love this product and will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Tylerphilapil

customer_reviews.title: Works well....then needs to be reapplied
customer_reviews.text: This product works well when you apply it and immediately produces a nice clean shiny finish. However be aware that if you used it on the outside trim of the car, it will quickly vanish within a few days. You will need to reapply to keep the glossy look. It works alot better on the interior of the car and maintains the nice clean shiny finish for longer than it does on the outside of the car.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Tire shine
customer_reviews.text: I own three cars that sit outdoors in the sun all day. I like to keep the tires looking nice and I have tried many products over the years. Some were messy (spray on that gets on the wheel, brakes), some were hard to apply, and some just didn't last. The VRP product goes on easily is long lasting and being water based doesn't make a mess. Dinged them one star because the product arrived with a tiny pinhole in the bottom of the bottle that leaked all over when I first tried to apply it. Email to Chemical Guys went un-answered. But the product itself works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nakamura

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After using it for a while I now see why my first time experience did not work, turns out my tires were "thirsty" after applying few layers after few car washes tires now look fresh and nice. Used on other cars and my bicycle and all good now :) Not what I expected. Used chemical guys sponge and washed wheels and tires before applying, doesn't give much shine, doesn't make tires "wet". Yes, it makes tires black, but nothing extraordinary. I even put two layers to make sure I didn't miss any spots or didn't pit enough first time. Still not much. I am quite disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Esenbek

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Really great product for me and my car needs! Not really greasy or oily .. really makes a great shine on tires and plastic trim!! Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: assassin's

customer_reviews.title: The product does exactly what it states
customer_reviews.text: It will turn old, grey plastics on your vehicle into dark shiny black plastic again. Problem is its kind of a pain in the butt to use. It gets all over other surfaces of the car since it doesn't "soak in" really. It's like a top coat, which makes it a bit of a mess to use. Wish this product had a special applicator that was the size of your cars trim, since using it with a towel sucked.
customer_reviews.author: James Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Attracts dirt
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item after watching a PAN video. use this on the bed rails and it is slick and leaves a slick feeling on my fingers. Also my bumper plastic gets dirtier now than it did before, so their claim to keeping the plastic cleaner longer is wrong. Also due and condensate does make the product pool and collect dirt like others have mentioned. A special degreaser shouldn't be necessary when i washed the car with Adams product as well as i have never applied anything to the bed rails for 1 year and need to since it started fading. Going to look for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible For Exterior Trim
customer_reviews.text: I take no pleasure in writing this review because I have more Chemical Guy stuff than Chemical Guys have Chemical Guys stuff. Anyway, before I purchased the product I seen a guy with a Slingshot say it did this exact same thing to his vynil trim and i thought he did something else wrong. Nope. Wipe on, wipe off. First rain, this happens. Now, it works excellent for the interiors. It's perfect. But do not use on ANY exterior! If this is your only bad product, you'd get 99.99% from me still. Sorry fellas.
customer_reviews.author: Sean A.

customer_reviews.title: If you do it right it's great!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at all the negative comments. You have to DEGREASE what you are putting it on or it will not work properly. I washed my Durango, degreased the tires and black trim with Purple Power and scrubbed them good and put one coat of the VRP on it all. It rained like hell the next day and drizzled for 2 days. It all looks just like they did when I applied the product - fantastic. Some of the pictures posted make me believe people were expecting miracles with their neglected parts to begin with. This is one of those products I am glad I bypassed the comments and tried for myself. Remember "With hard work comes the spoils".
customer_reviews.author: Adam Phillips

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shine and I noticed it cleans to some degree also. Lasts months, dries on glass and wipes off easily. KEEPS DUST AWAY!! Seriously keeps things looking clean. I have used it on dashes, plastic trim, radio faceplates, wrinkle finish paint, guage covers. NOT recommended for steering wheels. Rubber products MEH... You owe it to yourself to buy and try this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: M Ro

customer_reviews.title: Looks great if you never take the vehicle out of the garage
customer_reviews.text: I got this due to a lot of reviews, which I assume where posted right after people applied the product. but the truth is, it only looks and does what it says s long as you never take the vehicle out of the garage. as soon as it gets ANY MOISTURE on it, it washes it of, leaving Fugly dull marks where it was washed off. looks 10 times worse then it did before it was applied. save yourself the money and frustration, stay away from this product. not sure who this chemical guy is, but I am pretty sure he didn't pass the class.
customer_reviews.author: Yngwie L.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but doesn’t last very long
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product to use on tires and the black plastic trim that car manufacturers seem so fond of. It brought new life to the plastic trim, and the tires look shiny and clean. The only downside to this is that it doesn’t seem to last long. I find myself having to reapply it about once a week, which is fine because that’s about as often as I do my maintenance washes. Overall it’s a good product and the UV protection will really help with the fading you see on that plastic trim.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for exterior use Damaged my Door handles!
customer_reviews.text: Just as other reviewers have noted it does not work well on exterior plastics. It left these nasty streaks down the side of my metallic black paint where I applied it to the door handles. It also turned my handles fugly gray and they weren't that way before. Chemical guys need to get their act together and recall and rework this product or list not for use on exterior applications. Thoroughly unimpressed!! 70, 000 dollar truck looks like shit the moment it rains and I think it has permanently damaged my (once black now grey) door handles. Shame on you chemical guys!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Underperforming shine
customer_reviews.text: I was less then happy with the results of the shine from this product. The product is a thick white liquid with similar texture to hand and body lotions. It was easy to apply but after applying there was no shine so I applied a second coat on top of the first coat but still no shine. The next week I washed my car and applied a liberal amount that resulted in a lack luster shine. I got better results with Armor All than this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald B.

customer_reviews.title: Dress Up The Interior
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have product for the average person that likes to keep their car clean. This a good dressing for all vinyl and plastic inside your vehicle. It leaves a good sheen and isn't greasy to the touch. Its only downfall is that it is water based so it doesn't fare well on the exterior. It will wash away at the first si f n of water. It is easy to apply and remove as well. I like to dilute mine 5:1 and use it as a spray solution as it can be applied faster.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lee

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on the trim of my Ford F-150 one coat was all it took and looks real good haven't put it through any of its paces with water or off-roading and dust as far as its initial application it works well we'll see how well it holds up. Just wanted to update my review the coating only lasted about three days and was completely gone, I'm going to try to recoat it see if it lasts longer. I'm assuming it shouldn't have worn off so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this for tire dressing, but also used it for interior trim dressing as well. As far as tire dressing, this easily beats anything you can buy locally from Walmart or auto parts stores. Similar to Meg's Endurance Gel in performance and durability, yet no greasy residue or browning.
customer_reviews.author: Farley

customer_reviews.title: Received a compliment from a professional-car Detailer at a gas station.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using product on my tires and one time only on black rubber trim on exterior of 2015 Camry. True story I was at a local car wash/gas station/store when I got stopped by a guy with a dirty Lexus sedan. Long story short, he asked where I took my car or if I was a detailer. I said no, I use auto-wash and apply Chemical Guys product to tires only last time. Anyway, he thought my car looked great. That's it. I've used 4 times still have plenty left. 5 Stars *
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: USED ON MY 2018 SONATA - SUN DAMAGE TO WEATHER STRIPPING
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on the weather stripping on the top of my two year old veh. It did make it look more black under the shade however the next day I noticed the sunspots on the stripping was still there. I did the recommended applications per the chemical guy video for this product on YouTube. I was disappointed that it didn't work for that But I did use it on the interior and black paneling around my car and it worked as described. NO other complaints aside from the sun spots not going away.
customer_reviews.author: Reina A

customer_reviews.title: Great as a tire shine
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried this for any use other than a tire shine at the moment, but I love how this performs. It gives a nice satin type sheen to the tire. Keeps the tires from browning, but isn't glossy like other tire shine products. I've been happy with how long it seems to last, even driving around in the rain. Water is still beading up off the sidewall of the tires after a month of driving.
customer_reviews.author: Dwfox84

customer_reviews.title: Best product you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it three stars on longevity because it’s not a sticky mess. Comes off after one or two washers. Water-based and best shine it’s not like an oil slick. They got this formula perfect. See photo, it’ll stay looking like this without slinging it all down the side of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Neilio

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is without a doubt my favorite shine product I have found. I have been looking for something to keep my tires shiny without throwing product all over my car and this delivers. I even used it on the plastics on my polaris slingshot and it makes everything look brand new. I usually don't do reviews but I loved this product so much I had to write one for this!
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Great! Long Lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I tested CG VRP, Meguiars Hot Shine, and Turtle Wax Wet n' Black. All placed on clean tires at the same time. After one week, and a couple days of rain, the winner was clear. CG VRP was still intact (protection) with a decent sheen. The others were gone, the tires looked dry and dirty. Another thing I like about VRP is the finish. It has shine, but isn't too shiny which I prefer. It's not matte, but not as shiny as Hot Shine. I really like the product, the longevity and the protection.
customer_reviews.author: sgd26

customer_reviews.title: Messed up my white paint!
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a tire dressing. It gave my tires the best shine but left sling marks/spots on my paint. I have a white car but now got some brown marks/spots because of this product! Make sure to wipe down any sling marks ASAP or you’ll end up with marks on your paint.
customer_reviews.author: Roy D.

customer_reviews.title: If used proper it's a great product, prep work before applying will boast best results.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of Chemical Guys, and VRP is by far one of my favorite products. As stated in another review, you have to clean the surface well for the VRP to adhere properly. I've applied it to not only my interior but my front canards and rear diffuser and it hasn't had any run off or haze rain or shine. Use their No Nonsense cleaner in addition to VRP for prep work to remove any road grime, grease or old product and it will adhere proper. I give my applications a few hours minimum to cure and dry proper on the exterior before I drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Beckham

customer_reviews.title: It holds the black color of my plastic trims better than anything else I have used
customer_reviews.text: This product is outstanding. I did a good job cleaning the trims on my used Transit van and then applied the Chemical Guys TVD_107_16 V.R.P. It is really making the trims and tires look like new. Several people asked me what I used to make the plastic trims look so good. The color is staying deep black and has not faded since I applied the dressing. I love the dressing and can highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dieter Reese

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Guys TVD_107_16 V.R.P. Great tire dressing!
customer_reviews.text: First order showed up with just envelope, I think UPS shipping at fault there. Second order showed and this product is VERY good in my opinion. I like how it goes on smooth and doesn't sling or have an excessive shine to it. I like a nice deep black color and a glow.... not a oil looking shine. VRP will gives just what I'm looking for w/out the sling or excessive shine. One of the best tire dressings and can be used on vinyl, plastic or rubber. Highly recommend VRP for tire dressing!!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: My go to item!
customer_reviews.text: I do not claim to be the master guru of Car detailing. There are various products that can do the same thing from companies. I really like Chemical Guy's VRP. This product is great on tires, helps the shine last long! Also, I use it on the black trim and it does last several watches. I have not found this product to run. It has a nice scent of Sprees candy. 16 oz bottle almost lasted about 8 months I have 3 vehicles to wash. Highly reconmend.
customer_reviews.author: SnowPanther

customer_reviews.title: careful with application
customer_reviews.text: I bought to protect my rubber and black trim. Directions were that I could leave on and let dry OR wipe off. First application I choose to leave on. It ended up streaking terribly and I have not been able to get the steaks off. I have reapplied and wiped off and the streaks from the first application are still visible. Also after 2 weeks everywhere it was applied is dry and pasty again. I think the rubber and plastic looked better before I ever used this. Waste of my money and i'm worried i've damaged my expensive new vehicle. Also it's worth mentioning that I used it on my step rails and it made them extremely slippery for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: So bright it will blind ya!
customer_reviews.text: Goes on evenly. Lasts for a very long time. Has a great shine. Works well on both interior and exterior making my truck look better than it did off the showroom floor. Another great product by Chemical Guys. This will continue to be my go too shine.
customer_reviews.author: dustin moore

customer_reviews.title: Gr8t seller gr8t prdt
customer_reviews.text: Im truly a Chemical guys fan! I do love their VRP Trim stuff it is great. But are they better than any1 else....NO. It boils down to reliable companies (CG are good ones) and hard work on your car. You gotta put the work into your cars exterior and interior if you want it lookin like day 1 on year 20. Im Hapy this seller was good. Gr8t delivry, description the wrks. Will buy from again. Also, am SUPER HAPPY they heat wrapped the bottled to protect from potential leaks durin shipping #Smart
customer_reviews.author: Italiana

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of Chemical Guys for a while now, and this product "VRP" is great. First it goes on easy and does not leave a greasy mess or residue. You just put it on (I use a waxing pad) and then follow it up with a microfiber towel to pick up and extra product and brings it to a shine. It brings life back to dulled parts that fade over time and protects. Great buy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Very quick and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for my SUV with all the plastic around the bumpers and wheel wells. I little goes a long way. I especially like the way it doesn't smear on painted surfaces, like so many others, but wipes off easily saving time. Its great on door jam rubber and trim also. I wouldn't recommend it on interior plastic because it attracts dust and is a little too shiny for that purpose but for the other jobs its great!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick of Ormrod

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews, but I had to for this item. I've gotten things that were supposed to clean and make plastic look better and they did not work. I used this on my husband's motorcycle fairing and hard saddle bags and the finish looks like glass! I recommend this item for any motorcycle that has fiberglass parts. My husband's bike is a 1996 HD Eglide. It made the paint jump out and say, Look t me!"
customer_reviews.author: Julie Z.

customer_reviews.title: no greasy residue
customer_reviews.text: love this product. gives plastic vinyl and rubber a nice shine without the slimy feel of an armor-all type product. I apply it with a (hog bristle type) detail brush, let it sit a few minutes, then buff it off with a microfiber towel. looks and feels like new. even use it under my hood on wiring looms, tubing and plastic bits. (stay away from belts). I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jones

customer_reviews.title: Streaks if it gets wet
customer_reviews.text: That it looked great when I applied it but as soon as the morning dew hit it is started streaking. Tried several locations across a 2 week period with the same results. Mother back to black worked much better with no streaking but still looking at other products.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great when used with a sponge! I simply put a small line on the sponge and run it around my tire with out touching the rim! Works perfect! I love the products that this company puts out and have many of them... this is my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Cozy

customer_reviews.title: ZERO LONGEVITY
customer_reviews.text: Followed what they did in their video; cleaned and then applied. Looks good after you first put it on, but that's it. Had 5 days of sunshine, but then the rain came and it did the same thing as everyone was saying and their pictures are spot on. My car actually looks worse than before because now not only are my bumpers and fender trim back to being faded, they now have awful streaks on them.
customer_reviews.author: v8mustanger

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! I recently bought a used Honda Civic and this product alone was the best thing to help the car. It's not a shiny as I expected, which is a good thing. I just put some on a microfiber cloth and buffed it in and it gives the plastic a new kinda glow to it, not really shiny, not Armorall! This is one of my new favorites for car care.
customer_reviews.author: K_2013

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT...YOU WONT REGRET IT
customer_reviews.text: I've tried alot of different car care products. This stuff rocks. All in one for V R & P. No other tire shine has lasted as long as this stuff. Tires look great. Its water based so no petroleum worries. Shined up my dash, put armorall to shame. Brought life back to my faded exterior trim. Made It look new. It dries to a touch friendly non greasy finish. I love this stuff & it's all there in one product.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not gonna use this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the large number of good reviews. Normally that works. Not this time.... The product goes on easily and looks nice. However, every time it rains, an oily substance leeches onto the surface below. Example - the bed rails are black plastic on the top. I get streaks down the side of the truck every tine it rains. It’s going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: psdx

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, deep black finish!  Non-greasy.
customer_reviews.text: Goes on nice and easy. A little goes a long way. Use a sponge with bumps or rides to get the product into all areas of the tire. None greasy, and lasts over 2-3 weeks, keeping a deep black dry look. Doesn’t fly off when driving, and slinging up onto the car. One bottle should last a long time. Highly recommended. Got lots of compliments on how good the tires look.
customer_reviews.author: djhansensr

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to tire dressing. Easy to apply with no spray, and dries quickly, with no tire sling. Not overly shiny, just a nice, clean look. Also works great on doors, dash, and leather or plastic interior. No slippery or sticky residue. I see lots of bad reviews for poor performance on trim, it is water based so it will run when it rains. Personally I do not use it on exterior except for tires, so that is not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: I use this on a 2017 Tacoma more as a protectant than to bring back color on my trim . Although I do apply it every couple of weeks on my tires when they start getting dull again. What really surprised me was using it on the black plastic of a 1988 Big Bear 350 atv. It has never had anything done to it and stays outside year round . Brought the black back to almost new looking.
customer_reviews.author: Pauly

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It really works well. It really makes tue sidewall of my tire look new and clean. It is not that shinny as compared to other brand which is why i love this product for.
customer_reviews.author: Joey T.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid on Outside Trim
customer_reviews.text: V.R.P. applied nicely enough and it had 2 full days to settle on my black new car trim. The third day it rained and I had what looked like zebra stripes all over my outside trim. Do not buy this stuff for any place that will get wet as it does not work. I had to strip off this layer and used another product that does not cause discoloration and runs. Perhaps this works inside of car but it failed at what it was advertised to do for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paladin

customer_reviews.title: Easily taken off of exterior finishes
customer_reviews.text: Looks good when you first apply the product. This product should only be used for the interior. I used this product on my 04 Jeep Wrangler on the exterior black trim that was fading. I applied the product and it looked brand new. The next day it rained and the product washed off and left a blotchy finish on all of the trims. I thought the product didn’t set properly so I applied it again and it rained a week later and the same thing happened. The product does not last on the exterior finishes of a vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: I had faith in this product but I'm completely disappointed. I liked Chemical Guys products until I used ...
customer_reviews.text: Applied as directed to exterior plastic trim and buffed out with a microfiber towel. It rained the next day. It looks AWFUL. Streaks and runs everywhere. I had faith in this product but I'm completely disappointed. I liked Chemical Guys products until I used VRP. If you keep your car in a garage it's great. If you venture outside, prepare to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Norman R. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Good results
customer_reviews.text: I cleaned my tires thoroughly, applied a small amount of this product to my tires, and had a nice low gloss look to my tires. The durability of this product lasts longer than most other tire dressings. It's really great!!
customer_reviews.author: Hammertime

customer_reviews.title: Number #1
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome I totally love it. It works awesome i rate this product 10/10. It makes my interior looks new. It leves tour interior Very shiny, and not greasy like other products. Is a must have for your vehicles, i be using this product for so many years to come. Make a favor for yourself and purchase it u will see what im talking about the best of the best. Thank u
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a shiny non greasy engine bay, you need this stuff! I used it for one application and I was blown away. Armor all has nothing on this product. It's safe on rubber and plastic and vinyl. It's water based! I used a 1" paint brush to get in those hard to reach areas. Let it soak for 20-30 minutes and then wiped it off! My jeep xj is a 1988!
customer_reviews.author: Nola H./Robert H

customer_reviews.title: Does not last.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for tire dressing after the rave reviews, and found it pretty disappointing. It goes on nice, but dries matte. Very little shine, and as soon as it gets wet....gone. I'm talkin' a puddle will knock this stuff right off. Go with a petroleum based tire shine. This water based stuff is for the birds...
customer_reviews.author: Bootney Lee Farnsworth

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Say no more about the quality of products from Chemical Guys. VRP is a game changer is non grease and instant dry for a beautiful shine. I have used great products such as Wolfgang and Pinnacle for car interiors and they are good, but VRP is way better. In the pictures is a 2000 Saturn LS1 with over 300K miles on it and VRP does the job right
customer_reviews.author: Edwin V.

customer_reviews.title: Car looks good
customer_reviews.text: this is my first time using this product ever but I have to say I'm pretty impressed with the shine that it leaves and it instantly dries. Iwas able to clean the entire car in less than 10 minutes. I can't wait to see how long The shining last and protection from the sun once again great product I look forward to purchasing more items from this line.
customer_reviews.author: angeleyes

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely good product
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my interior... door seals, dash, console.. ect. It goes on easy and lasts. It is definitely not "none greasy" just use it appropriately. Dont use it on anything your shoes will come in contact with ie. Floor mats, pedals, steps. And avoid your steering wheel. Other than those items, apply it and love it! Also....This stuff smells really good! I have used it on all the plastic components under my hood and it still looks like the day I applied it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes my tires look like new cars in the dealership
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of tires in a new car dealer showroom. They are not too shiny, and have a nice understated blackness to them. This stuff seems to work the same, and my tires look brand new after a car wash and an application of this product. So far, I am very pleased. I understand that I can also use this on interior plastic and vinyl components but I am a loyal user of Lexol Vinylex for that, and my interior, especially the dashboard, looks brand new without any annoying sheen.
customer_reviews.author: Five 28

customer_reviews.title: No other product comes close
customer_reviews.text: Ok wow this product worked on everything and just wow. Leather/plastic and rubber I have this saved on my truck list just cause I will buy more super easy to apply and long lasting even did the plastic on the out side of my truck and it’s lasting. Will recommend and don’t hesitate to buy you will love this product
customer_reviews.author: Joemom

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use Meguiars w/ scotchguard, and I have done some amazing things with that stuff, I stull have some meguirars that I use occassionally, BUT! I am all in on this stuff, I put it in a bottle and water it down and you get a better spray area and less of a film. I use it w/ microfiber towels. Once I have wiped down the entire surface, I go over it with a clean microfiber towel. It gave my pick-up and my company pick-up a shine like it has never has before.
customer_reviews.author: Beardiful_Grim

customer_reviews.title: It's the best restoration product I ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I used product on my Ford F450 Bed Rails. They turned out terrific, just like new. No greasy residue, dried with a wet finish. Did all the plastic on the Truck, looks like new. Great products and company with a great reputation!
customer_reviews.author: Artemus Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Don't get it wet
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is not meant for exterior use. Used some on the plastic around my side mirrors and it ran down my paint when it rained. Don't buy this stuff if you plan on using it on the outside of your car. Really disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: ZJE

customer_reviews.title: I gives a clear sleek look to the vehicle
customer_reviews.text: I use this product on my Crimson F150. I like this product because in brings out all the metal flake in the paint and gives the truck gold and silver highlights. I feels sleek to touch and dirt does not adhere to it. I only repeat application about every 3 to four weeks. Great product my truck is an older yr model and I get compliments like my truck is a new truck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy on looks Great
customer_reviews.text: This is another great product from CG. I have used this on my dash, tires, and door panels. No splatter when you drive your car out of the garage. Holds up as well or better than any other vinyl and rubber protectant. Gr8 buy Gr8 product. Would highly recommend for anyone who likes a great looking vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Al Dons

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking, this is the one.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product I’ve found that actually brings back the deep black color of exterior trim. Use a sponge applicator and make sure the surfaces are completely dry. Also works very well on tires and interior plastics. Does leave a wet look on plastics but can be filled with the additional step of wiping with a micro fiber towel.
customer_reviews.author: Aune

customer_reviews.title: One star for what it isn't
customer_reviews.text: If this was supposed to be non slippery, I need to know where they sent it because this is as bad as Armor-all only it lasts longer. If you want Armor All on steroids, buy this. If you want to shine up your floor mats and not bust your a** when a shoe hits the mat getting in? Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Gave it a try and was impressed
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best and longest lasting product I have used on tire sidewalls. Even after driving in wet conditions this stuff continues to shine. It didn’t seem to work well on some of the external trim on my EVO X, but it did help mask some of my sloppy wax application on some parts, like the rear diffuser.
customer_reviews.author: Ball_O_Fire

customer_reviews.title: Tires shine like never before
customer_reviews.text: I have used armor all for most of my life when it came to dressing the tires after washing the car so I took a chance with this product after hearing so much good things about it from detailing channels on Youtube and I am glad that I did. This stuff really brings out a nice deep black shine to all of my fading tires. I really need the layer of protection in the constant heat and sun that my car gets being parked outside in Cali. I highly recommend using this product with the Adam's pro tire hex grip applicator since it made the application so much easier than using a towel.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for any DIY detailer.
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, this is my new favorite product. Wipe this on some trim or an interior panel and its almost instantly clean (if dyed) or instantly showroom new (if black). I use it on interior trim, exterior trim, engine bay components, and tires. EVERYTHING LOOKS AWESOME after using it. When we get together for 'detail parties' to help share the elbow grease and get a few cars done in one day, everyone gets excited when I bring out the VRP.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kaul

customer_reviews.title: Best product for my Jeep
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this stuff for years. My Jeep is a 2014 wrangler unlimited and this is the only stuff that keep the plastic parts looking new! You don’t need a lot and it does it’s thing. I’ve used it inside the Jeep as well but I feel like the inside gets dirtier faster and with driving 3 dogs around I’m not worried about a shiny inside but seriously has worked wonders on my fender flares, handles and bumper. I use the sponge applicator and it works wonders. I do recommend you wear gloves because it leave that waxy feeling all over your hands.
customer_reviews.author: ERIKA

customer_reviews.title: great product, not greasy
customer_reviews.text: this is great product for plastics. i like it better than turtle wax or mothers plastic trim restorer they leave it greasy and overly shiny and over time collect dirt and road grime because of it. this product leaves your plastics with the natural, new car look, and is almost dry to the touch. this also has some UV protection so you can put it on new cars and protect the plastics from sun damage.
customer_reviews.author: WE_BE_KILLING_UM

customer_reviews.title: Really great, just don’t use on outside trim
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product honestly. But people think that it’s going to permanently rejuvenate their trim but that just a problem with your manufacture of the vehicle it’s just either they suck at making their plastic trim last or you suck for not maintaining the plastic trim right . But either way it makes my tires shine for weeks and the inside of my dash last even longer. I’ve had great feedbacks from my customers about where I apply this product it’s great just don’t use it on outside of any plastic trim
customer_reviews.author: pedro arellano

customer_reviews.title: Leaking bottle from the very beginning!
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and all but sometimes goes away quick. Also main complaint is that the bottle I got leaked EVERYWHERE even when I first took it out! Which right from the beginning made me mad about it because I would consider that “bad representation” Of the product and chemical guys products because it leaks. I am assuming not all of them are like that but it makes me mad since I spent my money on it. To get a leaking bottle. So I didn’t even get all of the products useable
customer_reviews.author: Jake.k

customer_reviews.title: Overall great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to try this product because I had seen other reviews where it was streaky after coming in contact with water. I ending up getting it anyway and I’m glad I did! Overall it’s a beautiful product makes trims look like new! I even use it on my tires. I found the beat way to apply this product is by actually taking the time and rubbing it in, not just swiping it on. Also making sure not to use and excessive amount of product. If you apply to much it’s obviously going to leak off with water. The day after I applied it we got some rain but the trims where completely fine! Definitely worth giving a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Drips when wet, not the best for tires
customer_reviews.text: It works great on plastic and vinyl, really adds shine. The trouble is when it gets wet it drips or runs. I put this on the plastic handle for my tailgate, and now I have to clay it to take it off the paint. It's okay on tires, the same drip / run problem occurs and the shine is only Okay. I've used other products with a much better wow factor for tires. Just don't put it on anything that can drip and it works great....
customer_reviews.author: Aaron T

customer_reviews.title: Restores vinyl and rubber to a "new" appearance.
customer_reviews.text: I use VRP on my tires and the dash inside. I like that it goes on easy and give a new clean look, without being overly "wet & slick". If you want your tires to have the super gloss appearance of some brands; don't use this. If you want your vinyl and rubber to look like it did when it was new; get VRP.
customer_reviews.author: Water Monkey

customer_reviews.title: It looks like a new car!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I saw someone else recommend this product in a Honda Element FB group and I decided to try this out. We bought our element used from someone earlier this year and the plastic was all faded. This kit was easy to apply and wow it makes the car look brand new !!!! You can see the before/after in one photo. highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: The Lovely Lyss

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Balance
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I’m picky about my car’s appearance. I’ve lost count of the tire dressings I’ve tried. I like tire sheen halfway between shiny and matte. I like that it’s a gel so I can apply it precisely where I want to. There’s no sling and it dries quickly, and it lasts a couple of weeks. No question this is THE best dressing I’ve used. Great job Chemical Guys!
customer_reviews.author: ckw

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, Just wish it lasted just a bit longer on tires...
customer_reviews.text: I really like how this stuff works. Its really good for plastic trim. It also leaves tires with the PERFECT finish, not to dull, not too shiny. But it only lasts about a week on tires before it starts fading away.. thats my only complaint. Still gets 5 stars from me though...
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Best Tire shine ever !!
customer_reviews.text: By far. The best tire shine. Brings the color of the tire rubber, like if you painted it. Lasts about a month, driving every day, with rain. I use the Adam’s polisher pad to apply this. Dries quick and does not leavy any residue, and best part, you dont use much so the botlle will last you Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Alcala Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Does not leave shiney. Since water based, it can be diluted with distilled water to make a spray form. KEEP IN MIND, since it is water based, if used on exterior of vehicle, if it is rained on, you will see the product run and you have to reapply to have a uniform look again if the surface is not properly cleaned. It is for protection from UV damage and to condition the area. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cole Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy It
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked at the reviews before I purchased. I applied V.R.P. to my cargo rack and it all washed off with the morning dew leaving a nasty mess on my windows/paint. Not only does it wash off easily it leaves a horrible greasy stain behind. The description says "Long Lasting" but it won't make it through one day.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Star

customer_reviews.title: The Truth
customer_reviews.text: I really have to take the time to leave my review of Chemical Guys VRP dressing. I LOVE this product. It does such a great job restoring the quality finish to my dash, door trim or any other plastic pieces in my 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan. Even on my tires it exceeds my expectations. 5/5 stars across the board in all categories. To me, the is a professional product that raises the level of quality to my detailing work.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Nestman

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: A little of this product goes a long way. I've been using it on my wife's and my car for about 3 months and we have both noticed that the shine stays longer than with other products. We really like it because it does not leave a greasy feel to it. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mario

product_meta.title: Chemical Guys TVD_107_16 V.R.P. Vinyl, Rubber and Plastic Non-Greasy Dry-to-the-Touch Long Lasting Super Shine Dressing for Tires, Trim and More (16 Oz)
product_meta.description: Size:16 ozV.R.P. super shine dressing is a dry-to-the-tough water-based dressing that works great on leather, vinyl, plastic, rubber and tires. V.R.P. can be used on both interior and exterior surfaces. It creates an invisible shield that repels water, dirt and dust. It also protects surfaces from damaging UV rays. V.R.P. super shine dressing resists drying, fading and cracking surfaces to aid in maintaining interior and exterior surfaces while at the same time enhancing shine and image. V.R.P. super shine dressing not only provides shine and protection, it is 100 percent dry-to-the-touch which means it is never greasy or oily. V.R.P. super shine dressing brings out the true shine and texture of leather, vinyl, plastic, rubber and tires. It can be applied as often as you like without the fear of any clouding or discoloration. V.R.P. super shine dressing features patented UV absorbers that penetrate deep into surfaces and act as a protective barrier against harmful UV rays that can cause premature aging, cracking, fading and peeling. The UV protection in V.R.P. Dressing protects surfaces from fading and dulling.
feature_bullets: Restore and maintain shine: Penetrates deep to nourish and restore vinyl, rubber and plastic. Refined cream creates a long lasting, non greasy dry to the touch high, rich shine on tires, dashboards, door panels, bumper trim, windshield cowls, rubber tire sidewalls, grilles, grates, side mirrors and more

Protect against fading: Refined cream restores and protects vinyl, rubber and plastic against UV damage and from becoming faded and cracked. Specialty UV blockers act like sunscreen to repel harmful solar rays that bleach, fade, and crack sensitive car parts over time

Non greasy water based formula: Achieve a non greasy long lasting deep wet look on both interior and exterior vinyl, rubber, plastic and tires with this water based dressing. Quick and easy application with no sling and no mess

The #1 Brand in car care: Beginners and professionals alike choose chemical guys, not only for the finest car care products, but the world class customer support and vast detailing knowledge. Chemical guys is more than a brand it's a lifestyle with a worldwide following
Satisfaction guaranteed: Our customers love our products. We love our products, and we want to make sure you love them too

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,255 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
